text: The Eastern cottontail (Sylvilagus floridanus) is a New World cottontail rabbit, a member of the family Leporidae. It is the most common rabbit species in North America. ==Sub-species of the Eastern cottontail== *Sylvilagus floridanus alacer - found north of Mexico.Bangs, 1896, 'Wilson and Reeder's Mammal Species of the world', Bucknell University, https://www.departments.bucknell.edu/biology/resources/msw3/browse.asp?id=13500332 *Sylvilagus floridanus ammophilus *Sylvilagus floridanus avius *Sylvilagus floridanus aztecus *Sylvilagus floridanus chapmani - found north of Mexico.Allen, J., 1899, Wilson and Reeder's Mammal Species of the World, Bucknell University, https://www.departments.bucknell.edu/biology/resources/msw3/browse.asp?id=13500333 *Sylvilagus floridanus chiapensis *Sylvilagus floridanus cognatus *Sylvilagus floridanus connectens *Sylvilagus floridanus continentis *Sylvilagus floridanus costaricensis *Sylvilagus floridanus cumanicus *Sylvilagus floridanus floridanus *Sylvilagus floridanus hesperius *Sylvilagus floridanus hitchensi *Sylvilagus flordanus holzneri *Sylvilagus floridanus hondurensis *Sylvilagus floridanus llanensis *Sylvilagus floridanus mallurus *Sylvilagus floridanus margaritae *Sylvilagus floridanus mearnsi *Sylvilagus floridanus nelsoni *Sylvilagus floridanus nigronuchalis *Sylvilagus floridanus orinoci *Sylvilagus floridanus orizabae *Sylvilagus floridanus paulsoni *Sylvilagus floridanus purgatus *Sylvilagus floridanus restrictus *Sylvilagus floridanus russatus *Sylvilagus floridanus similis *Sylvilagus floridanus subcinctus *Sylvilagus floridanus superciliaris *Sylvilagus floridanus valenciae *Sylvilagus floridanus yucatanicus ==References== Category:Lagomorphs Category:Mammals of North America Category:Mammals of South America
title: Eastern cottontail
